text: The Marly series is a series of twenty oil on canvas paintings by Alfred Sisley of the town of Marly-Le-Roi. Sisley lived in the town from his return from a painting trip to England at the end of 1874 until he moved to live in Sèvres in August 1877. ==List== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin-top:0.5em;" |- ! scope="col" | Title ! scope="col" | Museum ! scope="col" | Town ! scope="col" | Country ! scope="col" | Dimensions (cm) ! scope="col" | Year ! scope="col" | No.François Daulte, Alfred Sisley: Catalogue Raisonné, La Bibliothèque des Arts, 1998 () ! scope="col" class="unsortable" width="100px" | Image |- | | | | | align="right" | | align="right" | 1873 | align="right" | D69 | 100px |- | | National Gallery | London | United Kingdom | align="right" | 49,5 × 65,4 | align="right" | 1875 | align="right" | D152 | 100px |- | | Private collection | New YorkMaryAnne Stevens, Alfred Sisley, The Yale University Press, 1992, , p. 160 | | align="right" | 50 × 65 | align="right" | 1875 | align="right" | D154 | 100px |- | | Private collection | | | align="right" | 50 × 65 | align="right" | 1875 | align="right" | D155 ???
